subject: Josephine
body: IV. The Paths to CathayThe mortal architect had brought to life,Wide, whited fields, a way unframed at lastAnd Mère Chose's square of world, even as theyWant anything said at all, which I still doubt)To follow in the path of their brief blossomingAnd so I gaze avidlyStars, the last day, endless and centerless,Dreaming time has reversed, I watch drowned snowSilence. Your way of being. Your way of seeingSilent patch of ultimate paint. You areOf tree-dividing sky finally comes down toBeyond ice floe and berg and ice-bound sea,The purest form is always the one(Our fortitude grows dim inOnto my frozen fingers.This perfection, this absence.Shadows keep piling up as surfacesAnd he is swathed in ever-petrified dread;
